items.title: Coal Is Rising Along with Solar in the U.S. Power System, While Gas Loses a Step
items.description: Coal and utility-scale solar power each gained market share in the first half of this year, newly released data on U.S. electricity generation show. items.title: Zambia Ordered a Mining Company to Pay Villagers After a Toxic Waste Spill. The Firm Made Them Sign Away Their Rights First

items.title: Fossil-Fueled Climate Heating Set the Stage for Devastating Fires in Spain and Portugal This Summer
items.description: A new attribution report published Thursday shows that global warming made the extreme hot and dry conditions preceding this summer’s wildfires in Portugal and Spain 40 times more likely and 30 percent more intense than in pre-industrial climate conditions. The fires have killed at least eight people, and tens of thousands were evacuated as health-damaging […]

items.title: Dozens of Scientists Call DOE Climate Report ‘Fundamentally Incorrect’
